ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely encourage students to take this class. It provides for a great overview of bench to bedside research.
Yes, especially those who are interested in translational research.

For a student whois interested in drug development or pharmacology, I think this course is good introductory class to understand the translation from bench to bedside as well as understanding the approval process. Overall, I think for anyone who is pursuing biomedical research, this course is worthwhile to better appreciate the drug development process.

A class during which grad students from the basic and medical sciences get together to learn about all the steps from identification/design of a novel therapeutics to the clinical realm.Yes I would recommend it.

This course provided an overview of two important areas in drug development- first, drug design, and second, the drug approval process, which is most helpful to students interested in pharmacology, i.e. developing new medications, or clinical trials research.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: It helped me gain an understanding of the clinical aspect of the drug design and approval process. I have never been to a clinical research unit before and it was definitely a very interesting and eye opening tour.
Yes, this course provided me with a general idea how human investigation works

I'm not sure that I will find myself in the future in drug development, but I do feel that I have gained a much better appreciation of all that is involved. And if my research does lead to development of a therapeutic, then this class definitely provided a good foundation for understanding the process.
I learned a great deal in this class that I think may be useful in the future.
This course provided a basis for my understanding of the steps that go into the development of new drugs, which is relevant to my area of research.
